summary: This bill, S.1931, aims to provide additional federal funding to states that support sexual assault survivors' rights. It amends the James M. Inhofe National Defense Authorization Act to incentivize states to enact laws or policies guaranteeing specific rights to survivors, referencing rights outlined in Title 18, United States Code, section 3772. The bill specifies tiered funding allocation based on the nature of the state's compliance. It also modifies existing law regarding the preservation of evidence kits and the process for requesting notification before their disposal or seeking further preservation.
